articles.title: Falling space junk from SpaceX, NASA, China risk life, property
articles.description: Spacecraft and debris fall out of orbit and back to Earth every day. Much of it burns up in the atmosphere, but some crashes to the ground.
articles.content:
It's raining rocket parts, and space-junk experts fear that someday a chunk of debris falling from Earth's orbit will strike a person.

articles.title: Broken plastic on Southwest plane window didn't post a safety threat: expert
articles.description: A TikTok appearing to show a shattered plane window quickly went viral, but the broken plastic piece didn't pose any actual safety threat, an expert told Insider.

articles.title: Remote work is driving up salaries in cities across the US
articles.description: White-collar salaries across the US are closing in on those in San Francisco, as remote work drives up paychecks in mid-size cities by as much as 24%.
